snippet: Genealogy can reveal secrets about all of us, at once: the emergence of our species, the political history of the world, and the origins of the social structures that dictate modern life.
abstract: Virginia Hughes reviews book The Invisible History of the Human Race: How DNA and History Shape Our Identities and Our Futures by Christine Kenneally.
